artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Tsunajima Kamekichi; Carver: Wada Yūjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 503.6; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 276.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: woman seated by a railing outdoors with moon in ULC, looking over her PR shoulder, with her PL hand on her chin, holding a piece of shrimp tempura in a chopstick in her PR hand; blue and white patterned plate with tempura and blue and white cup in LRC; woman wears grey, white and blue striped kimono and pink obi
markings: Artist’s seal: たいそ {Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 和田刻 {Wada koku}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Thirty-two Aspects of Behaviors (Fūzoku sanjūnisō 風俗三十二相)
text: No. 17 on the table of contents
title: Appearing Delicious, Behavior of a Prostitute of the Kaei Era
